basics.name: Daniel Ilies
basics.label: React JS Developer
basics.summary: Experienced React JS Developer with a Bachelor's degree in Informatics, skilled in developing robust, secure, and maintainable user interface components. Proficient in front-end development, ensuring optimal performance and compliance integration.

work.name: Bigfoot Startup
work.summary: Developed the AdsMedia full-stack retargeting platform, focusing on architecting and developing key dashboard and form components for campaign management.
highlights: Developed key dashboard and form components for campaign management using Nuxt.js, Vue.js, and TypeScript.
Implemented responsive design ensuring cross-browser compatibility for a seamless user experience.
Collaborated with the back-end on system design and API integration for smooth data flow.

work.name: DevelBox
work.summary: Led frontend development projects, focusing on improving user experience and translating designs into functional web pages.
highlights: Led frontend refactoring using Vue.js and Vuetify, improving user experience and page load times.
Collaborated with UI/UX designers to translate complex mockups into functional web pages for optimal performance.
Engaged in code reviews to maintain code quality and ensure robust application development.

work.name: CGS Romania
work.summary: Provided customer support while developing innovative automation solutions to improve team efficiency.
highlights: Developed Otis, a JavaScript-based templating software, automating form-filling and email generation.
Honed communication and problem-solving skills interacting with diverse customers.

courses: Building a modern fullstack web application (Thesis)

awards.title: 1st Place Innovation Contest
awards.summary: Won first place for developing Otis, a JavaScript-based templating software that automated form-filling and email generation

projects.name: IT-Hub - MERN Stack Social Media Web Application

highlights: Designed and developed dynamic frontend features using React.js.
Built UI features using a component-based architecture.
Managed application state effectively using Redux.
